intro: Aspidostemon glaber, commonly known as the smooth aspidostemon, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral structure, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
